data.title: Ether Me by Rogers, First Edition
data.meta_description: Ether and Me, or, "Just Relax" by Will Rogers, Joseph A. Stout (editoR) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Near Fine. First thus. Wonderful copy of this short work by one of the most popular celebrities of the last century Binding with illustrated cover is still tight and has only the slighted chipping at the corners The text is completely free of any markings or damage Apparent first edition, with no statement of later printings 77 pp.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good-. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. Grim Natwick (illustrator). First Edition. 77 pages. Originally appeared in the Saturday Evening post in 1927. The story of Will Rogers health issues, including his eventual gall bladder surgery, during his 1927 national tour to raise money for flood victims. A clean tight book with bumped corners, some fraying of the top overhang of the spine, shelfwear and light toning of the pages. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall. White Cloth Covered Boards.

Hardcover. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good-. First Edition; Seventh Printing. Minor rubbing and edgewear to the; 12mo 7" - 7½" tall; 77 pages Very Good dust jacket edges. Minor cracking to the bottom of the front hinge. Pervious owner's name has been scratched out on the front free end paper.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Grim Natwick (illustrator). 1st Edition. G.P. Putnam's Sons, New York. 1935. Hardcover. Stated 10th Impression of the Memorial Edition. Book is tight, square, and unmarked. Book Condition: Good +; light wear/bumping to head, tail and tips . DJ: Good+; NOT Price Clipped ($1.50); small missing pieces at head and tail; chipping and small closed tears to front panel edges. Tan and Brown paper covered boards with tan lettering on spine and front board. 77 pp 12mo. A medical tale by a great humorist accented with wonderful drawings of the medical/comical events in the story. Rogers describes the events surrounding a bout of gall stones from home treatment to the local small town doctor to the final solution in a hospital stay. A clean presentable copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. First Thus. Memorial Edition, Third Printing (July 1936). Published by G.P. Putnam, 1935. Octavo. Purple cloth boards with paper spine label and gray topstain. Book is very good; clean with no writing or names. Spine straight, binding tight and pages crisp. Boards have light shelf wear with spine fading. Light toning to endpapers. No dust jacket. Book placed in custom acetate protector. A very good copy of this hilarious sketch by famed comedian Will Rogers, illustrated throughout by Grim Natwick. 77 pages. 100% positive feedback. 30 day money back guarantee. NEXT DAY SHIPPING! Excellent customer service. Please email with any questions or if you would like a photo. All books packed carefully and ship with free delivery confirmation/tracking. All books come with free bookmarks. Ships from Southampton, New York. We Buy Books! Individual titles, libraries, collections. Message us if you have books to sell!.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. No Jacket. Grim Natwick (illustrator). 1st Edition. G.P. Putnam's Sons, New York. 1935. Hardcover. Stated 2nd Impression of the Memorial Edition. Book is tight, square, and unmarked but for inked out former owner name on the FFFP. Book Condition: Near Fine; light lower tip bumps; light dust soiling of upper boards. No DJ. Purple cloth boards and spine with paper paste on spine title and paste on drawing of Rogers and Physician. 77 pp 12mo. A medical tale by a great humorist accented with wonderful drawings of the medical/comical events in the story. Rogers describes the events surrounding a bout of gall stones from home treatment to the local small town doctor to the final solution in a hospital stay. A clean very presentable copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition, First Printing. First Edition in original unclipped dust jacket. Published 1929, with no additional printings listed on copyright page. Dust jacket unclipped with 1.00 on front inside flap. Clean white paper-covered boards with Herbert Johnson illustration, black lettering on cover and spine. Binding is tight and square, hinges are sound. Previous owner name and date in pencil on front free endpaper. Illustrated with drawings by Grim Natwick. 77 pages. Dust jacket is clean, has closed edge tears, slight edge wear, enclosed in new archival quality removable mylar cover.

Small Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. First edition. Jacket edges rubbed, jacket spine faded, jacket stained. Board edges rubbed. 1929 Small Hard Cover. 77 pp. If you think relaxing is easy, just try it yourself when you start reading this piece of uproariousness.--jacket.

First Edition. ETHER AND ME OR "JUST RELAX", Putnam, 1929, first edition, near fine in vg dust-wrapper. Illustrated by Grim Natwick. Most uncommon in such nice condition.
